items.description: River Windrush from Bourton to Newbridge
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels remain high but stable on the River Windrush following recent rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 30/10/24, especially in the Bourton on the Water and Newbridge areas. 
The forecast today is to remain largely dry. We expect river levels to continue slowly falling today but levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 31/10/24, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels remain high but stable on the Ginge Brook in Steventon. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 30/10/24. The forecast today is to remain largely dry. We expect river levels to remain high over the next days. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 31/10/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thame, Horsenden Stream and Chalgrove Brook

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thame, Horsenden Stream, Chalgrove Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but are now starting to fall on the River Thame. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, 30/10/24. The forecast today is to remain largely dry. We expect river levels to remain high for the next few days, but will continue to slowly fall. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 31/10/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dikler from Condicote to Little Rissington
Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
Groundwater levels remain high in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to remain high and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. No further rainfall is expected over the next few days.

Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.

Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. We will continue to monitor the situation closely.

This message will be updated by 16:00 PM on 05/11/2024.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
Weather conditions are expected to improve this morning and no further flooding is expected.
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cranborne Chase area
items.message:
Groundwater levels remain high in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to remain high and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. No rainfall is expected over the next few days.

Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.

Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. We will continue to monitor the situation closely.

This message will be updated by 16:00 PM on 05/11/2024.
